episodes.title: Ep. 1 Field Service vs. Therapy --- (JW) Sisters Living with Religious Trauma/Syndrome
episodes.description:
This is a Sketch!

Episode 1: Field Service vs. Therapy

The Why: In 2015, I actually had a therapist who was a baptized Witness, pioneer, and elder's wife.  (Looking back, how do I really know that she was truly a Witness????) 

Anyway, I paid $70 an hour for services, and the things she told me just blew my mind. One thing in particular was not to go to the elders with domestic violence issues. She explained that they won't listen and that they do not know how to unite. When I DID go to the elders again (because this is all I've known to do all my life) even after she told me not to, many things got worse.

The terrible thing about this experience is this sister was not trained in domestic violence so she was not able to help me exit safely, also she could not relate to what it means to be a Black Witness. Therefore, our time ended. Not to mention that I could not afford to pay any longer.

This character comes from that experience. Many JWs do not have professional careers because of being encouraged not to pursue higher education or to only get the absolute minimum necessary. However, what if there was an older sister who practiced before becoming a JW? What would her life be like? What would she have seen and observed?

Don't forget about my private FB group for Sisters Living with Religious Trauma/Syndrome. For all other interested ones, join me in my private Skool community. You can find me at skool.com/mrtscommunity.

The purpose of the Skool community is to be a safe, unbiased place to deconstruct & reclaim.

*Please remember this is a coaching/informational space and platform. This is not therapy. Also, I do not represent the JW organization. This is an independent coaching business.

Title: Sometimes Therapy Doesn't Work

For me and my children, therapy was a nightmare, and I made a promise to them that we would never do it again. Finding the RIGHT therapist isn't so easy at times. As a matter of fact, it could even be dangerous. Take a Listen! Allow me to explain!

episodes.title: Support & Education for Religious Trauma --- (JW) Sisters Living with Religious Trauma/Syndrome
episodes.description:
Title: MC's Religious Trauma Support Community 
Official Opening January 7

Thank you!!! I am learning and growing from you. I have officially graduated, and I want to share my next steps with you. I am opening a religious trauma support community.

The Purpose: To be a safe and unbiased place to deconstruct and reclaim.

Vocab:
Deconstruction: The process of evaluating and altering one's previously held beliefs, lifestyle, relationship, or worldview
Reclamation: The process of claiming or reasserting a right to a personal expression of humanity; rebuilding a belief (or lack of belief) system that works for the individual.

The Mission: To be a safe place of instruction for all to learn without bias about religious trauma and how it affects Jehovah's Witnesses mentally, emotionally, spiritually, financially, and sexually.

*Subscribe, Subscribe, Subscribe to my YouTube channel!

episodes.title: If JWs are a Cult? Aren't exJWs a Cult too? --- (JW) Sisters Living with Religious Trauma/Syndrome
episodes.description:
Please listen with caution to today's content. It is very sensitive in the fact that I am discussing the topic of cults and cult behavior. I hope to elevate my channel very soon by editing my videos, adding engaging thumbnails, a better setup (getting out of my car), and more, but I'm just not there yet. I share this to say that I stumbled over my words in a few areas or what I was trying to say didn't come out exactly like I wanted it to, but overall I'm pleased with the content. (And if I re-recorded, I'd probably messed up in a different area)

Please understand that I greatly appreciate the views, subscribers, comments, and feedback. Feel free to post your thoughts, or you are welcome to email me. However, what I do hope comes across clearly with the video is the following:

Freedom of Choice  

Thanks so much for watching! 

-‐------

episodes.title: Trigger Warning A Sneak Peak from my Play --- (JW) Sisters Living with Religious Trauma/Syndrome
episodes.description:
Trigger Warning 
Sensitive Content 

Yes!!!!

I absolutely did write the Worldwide Headquarters of Jehovah's Witness in Walkhill, NY, in a desperate effort to save my marriage. 

See, like so many of us who are abused by our JW husbands, we don't really want a divorce. We want them to stop. STOP hurting us! However, many of us can't get help, and that gives us no choice but to leave and divorce in many situations if we want to live. Then, we are disciplined or, in some cases, disfellowshipped for choosing safety.  

The WORST part about all of this for me was watching my youngest child lose her faith, so I have had to learn to have a lot of patience and to give her as much autonomy as reasonably possible while she heals from her own religious trauma.

As far as drama therapy and working with my amazing acting coach, I have so much work to do on this piece. I am so emotional, and you can't hear everything I'm saying clearly. The hardest part is when I say, "What about my baby girl? She doesn't believe God answers prayers, and she doesn't want me to pray with her, and I don't know what to do. Why NY?"

Now, when I perform this for my Midwest Tour next summer, I'll have to deliver this from my diaphragm, and to prepare, I am working on diaphragm exercises. 

Also, I am in the chair way too long. My acting coach and I are working on this. Should I stand up at one point and kick the chair back? Do I walk over to the other side and deliver lines? We'll figure it out! 

So, would you like to see my play? Would you like to be a sponsor for my play? How about joining my group coaching program this December? Let me know!

episodes.title: Let Mia Tell It Stage Play (Practice) - Grief Monologue
episodes.description:
So, does drama therapy cure trauma?

This is the question that I am researching as a capstone project for my studies at IWU for my Bachelor of Science in Psychology. To accomplish this, I will be performing my very own one-woman stage play, Let Mia Tell It, based on my 2018 self-published book. Afterward, I will teach a trauma-informed workshop entitled, "What's Hurting You?" 

The workshop will use the themes from the play as lessons to teach the audience about adverse childhood experiences, generational curses, emotional abuse, spiritual abuse, domestic violence, and more. 

Once I graduate, I'll continue on my journey toward becoming an amazing, skilled drama therapist. 

Check out my play and workshop! Audience participation is very much appreciated, and this play is for individuals 18 years and older only! My journey is full of adult content and possible triggering content, so beware. Other than that, I hope to see you! Dates will be released soon! 

Does drama therapy cure trauma? 

www.amazon.com/author/miracassidy
https://youtu.be/q5d2WwSrJgA

episodes.title: Mira's Muscular Dystrophy Project
episodes.description:
https://www.gofundme.com/f/miras-muscular-dystrophy

This fundraiser was created to help an exceptional, caring, African American disabled female in need. This female is intentionally unnamed.  I want to present her with a monetary gift to help her continue to fight a disease that has left her wheelchair-bound for the majority of her life, muscular dystrophy. 

Muscular dystrophy is a degenerative illness that begins in childhood. Life expectancy used to last until the teens but some individuals are now living much longer, like my cousin, the retired educator who this fundraiser is for. 

She has a brilliant mind and has accomplished so much. She is a member of Alpha Kappa Alpha Incorporated, holds two bachelor's degrees, and two master's degrees. She has helped dozens and dozens of students and individuals through the years, including me!

She gave me hope when I didn't have any and encouraged me to thrive no matter what tribulations I may face. I love her and her mother very much!

Creating this fundraiser has not been easy and I hope to get your support. Please watch the corresponding YouTube video that explains more, and please give what you can. No amount is too little! If you are unable to give then please share the YouTube video.

Why have I hidden the name of who this fundraiser is for? Though this wonderful woman is aware of my vision and has given me her blessing. She does not wish to be shown and I completely respect her wishes. Also, I am passionate about this topic and if I say something that another does not agree with then it is completely on me. 

Follow Mira Cassidy on social media for more information, videos, and content.

This fundraiser will run from February 15-March 1.

Thank you so much for your support!

Much Love,

Mira Cassidy

"Greeting family and friends. As you all know my mom has been my primary caregiver for my whole 50 years of life, and a superb one if I may say so myself! As we all age things are getting a little more difficult for the both of us. Due to me being courageous, earning a degree and working for 13 years as a special ed teacher, in Indiana I am not eligible for any services. Yeah, yeah, I know it doesn't make sense to anyone. However, my cousin has dedicated many hours trying to find a way to help us. Currently, she is hosting a fundraiser in our honor to assist us with caregiver expenses which are excessively High and outside of our regular monthly expenses. You all know that we are private and prideful but we don't want to block her blessing as well as our own. Please View and reshare the attached video. If you are moved to assist, we thank you and love you. If you are not, we thank you and love you. Tamika and Betty
https://youtu.be/fTR05gnyidA
Watch Mira Cassidy's video Miras muscular dystrophy project" - Tamika Black
https://www.facebook.com/tamika.black.520

#musculardystrophy #blacklivesmatter  #blacklivesstillmatter
